duties_responsibilities.duty: Collaborate and provide quality assurance input and solutions throughout the Product Development and Life Cycle process.
Develop and maintain standard protocols for all private brand products, and assist vendors in understanding protocols and standards.
Apply test methods to test private brand products at various stages of development, and report results to improve the products.
Conduct research and use risk analysis tools (e.g., FMEA) during design reviews to minimize quality and safety issues.
Resolve issues during product lifecycle to minimize delays in testing and get approval required to release purchase orders for shipping.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and vendors on all product, testing, and manufacturing issues.
Review QA processes, audit reports, and applicable government certifications for factories, and assure compliance with protocols.
Monitor and analyze feedback to determine cause, develop solutions, and ensure corrective actions are implemented.
Identify patterns of unsatisfactory vendor performance to facilitate and implement correction action plan.
Collaborate with QA Team for review of new suppliers or changes in facilities and conduct supplier approval process.
Conduct in-store visits for QA sample review and collection as needed.
Ensure test equipment used for internal testing is properly maintained and that all product complaints, issues, and concerns are documented.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent, preferably in Quality Assurance, Engineering or a related technical field (Master's preferred). HACCP Certification, SQF Practitioner, ASQ certification (Auditor, CQE, CQA, CRE) preferred.
